alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 8:40PM EST until February 12 at 5:36AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky... Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois...Indiana... Ohio River at Shawneetown, Mount Vernon, and Newburgh Dam. .Recent precipitation has caused the Ohio River to rise modestly this week. Several locations on the Ohio River will rise, crest, then fall below minor flood stage later this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 42.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Wednesday was 42.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 42.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
